channel.title: Featured Channel Previews from Miro
channel.description: Featured channels on the Miro Guide.

item.title: 365 Days of Astronomy - Weekly Edition
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

The 365 Days of Astronomy Podcast started as started as part of the International Year of Astronomy 2009 to publish one podcast of 5 to 10 minutes in duration for all 365 days. It proved so popular that at the end of 2009 the daily podcasts continued. The podcast episodes are written, recorded and produced by a wide range of participants around the world. This podcast comes out weekly and includes all the daily episodes from the week.

item.title: Cooking Up A Story: A Show about People, Food, and Sustainable Living
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

Cooking Up A Story offers a variety of shows and news about sustainable food and living and those working to change our world for the better through agriculture, ecology, and the environment. We set the table with the information you need to know with food stories, food news, cooking with fresh and organic foods, and share many recipes from our family and show stories.

Work Smart, 30 Second MBA, and business innovation videos

item.title: Greater Boston's Beat the Press
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

WGBH's Greater Boston presents Beat the Press - a look at media issues in Boston and beyond. Hosted by Emily Rooney, with Dan Kennedy of Northeastern University, television commentator Callie Crossley, and Joe Sciacca of the Boston Herald.

item.title: Marathon Training Academy
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

Listen as Angie shares her knowledge and experience as both a marathoner and registered nurse to help you run smarter, feel better, and go the distance. Whether you are a new runner or have logged many miles, Marathon Training Academy will propel you to the next level.

item.title: The Monocle Weekly
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

The Monocle Weekly signs on with a mix of smart discussion, previews, field reports and feature interviews. From our studio in London and our bureaux in Tokyo and New York, Monocle's editors focus on the horizon and explore the looming stories within the five areas that define our editorial agenda: global affairs, business, culture, design and consumer culture. Welcome to the third episode of the Monocle Weekly. This week we go to Gaza City to hear about the situation on the ground from Khaled Abdel Shafi, head of the regional United Nations Development Programme (UNDP). We also have an appointment with newspaper doctor Mario García, who has helped more than 500 newspapers rethink their business in the face of the digital revolution. Arianna Huffington, co-founder and editor-in-chief of The Huffington Post, joins us to talk about what lies in store for president-elect Barack Obama after his inauguration on 20 January. Finally, the third edition of Monocle Weekly is topped off by a summary of this week’s cultural highlights, cherry-picked by culture editor Robert Bound.

item.title: Tom's Top 5 (HD)
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

Tom cuts through the clutter, and counts down what's trending in the geek zeitgeist. From the hottest gadgets and downloads to the weirdest internet memes, Tom's Top 5 is the newest go-to resource for what people are really talking about in the nerdosphere

item.title: Waves of Tech
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

Interested in tech talk and tech news? Tired of all the complicated, drawn-out explanations when it comes to your tech issues? If so, the perfect podcast is waiting for you. Waves of Tech is a weekly, 30-minute podcast dedicated to technology and how its influences and impacts your daily life. We provide tips and report the news to listeners on a range of topics - mobile, social media, web browsing, security, and much more. We break down the news as it applies to you directly, explaining the real life implications of the world of tech. Sit back, listen, and join the conversation as Steve, Dave, and Mikee put a new spin on tech.

item.title: Gel Conference
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

These Gel presentations offer ideas and inspiration on a wide array of topics. New videos will be posted every week or so: follow us on Twitter, Facebook, RSS, or email to be notified. Our next event is Gel 2011 - please join us!

item.title: The Season
item.description:
Add this channel to your favorites in the Miro sidebar

The Season. Five lives. A world of possibilty. From the creators of the Dirtbag Diaries and 49 Megawatts comes a new HD-web television project following the five athletes through the course of a single season in Pacific Northwest. A veteran climber invents a new piece of gear. A pro snowboarder searches for a way to return to the roots of his sport. A boulderer returns from a series of injuries with new perspective. A family man goes to Whistler to test himself against the mountain bikingâs elite. A young sea kayaker with a troubled past sets out to reinvent his sport.
